ranked_diseases.disease_name: Adrenal hyperplasia, congenital, due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's features of clitoral hypertrophy and hyperpigmentation of the skin are highly consistent with congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency, as seen in all similar reference cases provided.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Adrenal hyperplasia, congenital, due to 11-beta-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: This form of CAH can also present with virilization (clitoral hypertrophy) and hyperpigmentation, though it is less common than 21-hydroxylase deficiency.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Adrenal insufficiency, congenital, with 46,XY sex reversal, partial or complete
ranked_diseases.explanation: This rare condition can present with hyperpigmentation and ambiguous genitalia, though it is less likely than CAH given the similar cases.
A rare form of CAH that can present with ambiguous genitalia and hyperpigmentation, but less common than 21-hydroxylase deficiency.
Can present with hyperpigmentation due to ACTH elevation, but clitoral hypertrophy is less typical, making it a less likely diagnosis.
